The choice of inhaled treatment device should be guided by the patient's co-ordination skills (necessary for certain metered dose inhalers) and inspiratory capacities (greater inspiratory flow required for powders).

Any prescription for inhaled treatment must be accompanied by instruction in the use of the inhalation device. Inhalation technique should be checked at each consultation.

A dedicated website with videos demonstrating the treatments available is freely accessible to patients and carers: <nowiki>https://splf.fr/videos-zephir/</nowiki>

question.title: What is the key factor in choosing an inhaled treatment device for asthma?

option_a.title: Co-ordination skills
option_a.description: The ability to coordinate the act of inhaling and pressing the canister

option_b.title: Inspiratory capacities
option_b.description: The amount of air that can be breathed in

option_c.title: Age and weight
option_c.description: The patient's age and weight are necessary for choosing the correct device

option_d.title: Medical history
option_d.description: The patient's medical history is necessary for choosing the correct device
